intro: Silene dictyoneura, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a striking member of the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense racemes, and the plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that persist through the winter. Silene dictyoneura thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
